  • SAP API Hub ‚Äì Business Partner API

  • SAP Help ‚Äì OData PATCH/MERGE operations

  • SAP Help ‚Äì Working with OData Services in S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: What is the best course of action for customers on IM and those in WM?
entry.content:
For customers currently using Inventory Management (IM) and those still operating with Warehouse Management (WM), the best course of action depends on their specific warehouse complexity and business needs, aligned with the SAP roadmap and support deadlines:  

For Customers on Inventory Management (IM) 

Continue using IM as the fundamental system for stock quantity and value management at the storage location level. 

- Evaluate the warehouse management needs: 

  - If your warehouse processes are basic and manual, complement IM with Stock Room Management in S/4HANA, which provides basic bin-level inventory without advanced warehouse features. 

  - For companies planning growth, automation, or increased complexity, prepare a transition to Extended Warehouse Management (EWM), which integrates tightly with IM and offers advanced control, automation, and real-time visibility. 

- IM remains your core inventory backbone regardless of the choice, ensuring compliance and financial integration. 

For Customers on Warehouse Management (WM) 

Plan and initiate migration before December 31, 2025, when WM license and support end in S/4HANA. 

- Assess warehouse complexity: 

  - If your warehouse is simple and manual, moving to Stock Room Management is the easier, quick-transition option. It requires minimal change and maintains basic WM functionality but has no future innovations planned. 

  - If your warehouse requires advanced functionality like automation, resource management, wave management, or integration with other SAP modules (e.g., PP, QM, TM), a migration to EWM (embedded or decentralized) is recommended for a future-proof solution. 

- Migration strategies can be: 

  - Gradual approach: migrate to S/4HANA first and then transition to EWM in phases. 

  - Big bang migration: a comprehensive move to EWM aligned with S/4HANA go-live. 

  - Decentralized EWM: migrate warehouse management independently of the ERP system for flexibility. 

- Early migration allows time for process optimization, change management, and leveraging EWM‚Äôs advanced features to gain competitive advantage. 

Summary Recommendations 

Customer Type 

Recommended Action 

Benefits 

Considerations 

IM-only users 

Use IM with Stock Room Management for basics; plan EWM adoption for complex needs 

Smooth transition; basic to advanced features 

Stock Room Management not innovative; EWM requires investment 

WM users in S/4HANA 

Migrate to Stock Room Management (simple) or EWM (advanced) before 12/31/2025 

Compliance, future-proofing, feature access 

Migration requires planning & resources 

WM users on ECC 

Continue WM until 12/31/2027; use extended maintenance until 2030; plan S/4HANA & EWM migration 

Longer runway; phased migration possible 

Extended maintenance limited; eventual migration necessary 

In essence, the best course of action is to start your migration planning now‚Äîwhether transitioning from WM to EWM/Stock Room Management or expanding IM integration‚Äîto ensure uninterrupted support, leverage advanced capabilities, and future-proof your warehouse and inventory management in line with SAP‚Äôs evolving platform. 

Ready to Secure Your Competitive Advantage? 

Let‚Äôs talk!  

Book a consultation to assess your current SAP inventory and warehouse setup and build a tailored roadmap to future-proof your operations beyond WM‚Äôs end of life. 

Click Book a Call or send a message to start your journey toward streamlined, resilient warehouse management. Your supply chain deserves the best‚Äîlet‚Äôs make it happen.

entry.title: Re: Where can I check the real-time cost of CAL?
entry.content:
Hello jewooklee ,

Almost all appliance templates available in our library offer a 30-day free trial period during which you do not need SAP Cloud Appliance Library subscription. To continue using this template beyond the free trial period, you need to purchase a SAP Cloud Appliance Library subscription and bring valid licenses for the products contained in the used by you appliance template. For more information, see this blog post .

Regardless of whether your appliance is in a trial period or beyond , you always have to pay the infrastructure costs for it directly on the cloud provider.

We have an embedded cost forecast in SAP Cloud Appliance Library. You will find a ‚ÄúCalculate Costs‚Äù function in the details of each Appliance Template. This function is also accessible with exploring and not logging into SAP Cloud Appliance Library.

Note that the cost calculation is based on the public hyperscaler price lists and we provide an estimated snapshot of the allocated costs. If you want to monitor your expenses strictly, then use directly the tools/console offered by the cloud provider.

Our FAQs https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/cloud-appliance-library/appliance-templates-faq/faq-subscription-costs and https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/cloud-appliance-library/appliance-templates-faq/faq-trial-templates could also be useful.

Best regards,

Tsvetinka

entry.title: Re: CDS for block function in engagement projecct
entry.content:
Hello @Shahana 

The CDS view I_EntProjElmntBlockFunc_2, mentioned in some replies, is specific to Enterprise Projects, Project System, and does not include Engagement Projects in Professional Services. That's why the block information isn't available there.

For engagement projects, the block function is accessible via dedicated CDS views.

  • C_EngagementProjectTP has released the API view, which includes the project-level block indicator, ProjectIsBlocked.
  • The C_EngmtProjWorkPkgTP includes the block indicator at the work package level, namely WorkPackageIsBlocked.

If you need a consolidated report on project, work package, and block statuses, you can create a Custom CDS View in the Custom CDS Views app by combining these released views.

Please use C_EngagementProjectTP and C_EngmtProjWorkPkgTP for Engagement Projects instead of I_EntProjElmntBlockFunc_2, which is only applicable to Enterprise Projects.

SAP Documentation References,

  • SAP Help ‚Äì Engagement Project CDS Views
  • SAP API Hub ‚Äì Engagement Project API

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to post noted items in S4H Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @nurulaffzan 

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, manually posting items with posting keys is not possible; instead, noted items are automatically generated via the Bank Guarantee Management process Scope Item 2NZ  Display Treasury Alerts - Posting

This is how it works

Activate Scope Item 2NZ ‚Äì Bank Guarantee Management in your system via Central Business Configuration (CBC).

Use the Manage Bank Guarantees app to create a new guarantee.

    • You can issue or receive guarantees.
    • You maintain details such as guarantee type, amount, validity period, and bank.

When the guarantee is saved, the system automatically generates a noted item in the background.

    • This noted item is statistical (it does not update balances).
    • It can be monitored in apps such as Display Line Items in General Ledger or directly in Manage Bank Guarantees.

The specified item remains until the guarantee either expires or is settled, ensuring its continued visibility in receivables and payables reports.

You will be able to optimise below processes.

  • Full tracking of guarantees (expiry, due dates, amount).
  • Automatic integration with Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable.
  • Elimination of manual posting of noted items.

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: CAP with Local App Previews ‚Äì Tips for Smooth Development
entry.content:
UI5 has recently introduced Virtual Endpoints, eliminating the need for sandbox files and reducing maintenance effort in local previews. For details, please read the blog post below:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/streamlining-local-app-previews-virtual-endpoints-for-seamless-development/ba-p/14155498

I have tried virtual endpoints with CAP Node.js, and would like to share a few things I noticed.

TypeScript as a prerequisite

By default, you will not see the "Use virtual endpoints for local preview" option. This option becomes available once you enable TypeScript.

Select the #app-preview endpoint for testing the app inside Fiori Launchpad

When you start the server with `cds watch`, you will see several options for opening the app. The #app-preview option is optimal choice for testing the app inside the Fiori Launchpad (sandbox).

Reinstall dependencies after build

After building the MTA, you will not see the virtual endpoints anymore. This is due to the `npm ci` command executed during the build (I haven't dug deeper into the cause). To enable the virtual endpoints again, simply run `npm install`.

That's it. I hope this post is useful.

entry.title: Re: How to Synchronize Production Order Dates Back to Net...
entry.content:
There is no standard functionality to automatically change a PS schedule based on production orders. 

I never advised clients to automatically update the PS project schedule because something slipped in production.  In the STO process the PS schedule reflects the agreement with the customer such as when you will ship the final assembly.

When PS sends to reservation date to MRP it should stand as a requirement.  If the PP order cannot meet the demand date then someone needs to negotiate a new date, MRP acts as a referee and you can see the exception mismatches.  If you automatically change the PS schedule then everything looks in agreement and you lose visibility of the date exceptions.

entry.title: Re: initial project stock upload 561Q is not reflected in cji3 report or plan/actual report
entry.content:
Conversions can be tricky.

Please check the following:

1.  Are your project using Valuated or Non-Valuated Project Stock?

2.  Are your WBS elements statistical?

3.  For Valuated Project stock it looks like you have done everything correct where the 561Q has but the material into inventory on a quantity and value basis.  You won't see actual costs on the project until the material GI to the project.

4.  There is a way to record a valuated project stock GR against a balance sheet G/L account via a Statistical Cost Element.  

From a business perspective what are you missing from the 561Q posting?

entry.title: SAP Business AI ‚Äì Driving the Next Wave of Enterprise Innovation
entry.content:
Why It Matters

AI is no longer a distant concept‚Äîit‚Äôs transforming how businesses operate today. Generative AI alone is projected to add up to $4.4 trillion in global productivity within the next five years. For SAP customers, who generate 87% of the world‚Äôs commerce, the impact of embedding AI directly into core business processes is both immediate and profound.

Key Highlights:

Joule ‚Äì The AI Copilot

  • Acts as SAP‚Äôs unified front end, enabling users to work in natural language.

  • Delivers context-aware insights, transaction execution, and navigation across SAP apps.

  • Boosts efficiency by up to 80% for employees.

  • Coordinates specialized AI agents for complex tasks (e.g., dispute resolution, sustainability planning).

  • Integrates with Microsoft Copilot for Office 365 for seamless cross-platform experiences.

Embedded AI ‚Äì Innovation at Scale

  • AI features are built directly into SAP‚Äôs cloud solutions (ERP, Supply Chain, HCM, CRM, Procurement, etc.).

  • Use cases already improving business outcomes:

    • Henkel ‚Üí Faster, data-driven decisions with AI in SAP Analytics Cloud.

    • FC Bayern Munich ‚Üí Accelerated recruiting with generative AI in SAP SuccessFactors.

    • Gibson ‚Üí Boosted email revenue by 50% through AI-powered customer engagement.

  • Over 100+ new AI features released in 2024, with continuous quarterly rollouts.

AI Foundation ‚Äì Building Custom Solutions

  • Part of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

  • Provides developers with reusable AI services, lifecycle management, and access to leading LLMs (OpenAI, Google, AWS, Meta, etc.).

  • Offers deep integration with SAP HANA Cloud Vector Engine and SAP Knowledge Graph for contextualized business data.

  • Enables low-data AI innovation, such as invoice due date predictions or sales order auto-filling .

Responsible AI at SAP

  • Commitment to ethics, privacy, and security:

    • No partner or third-party models are trained on customer data.

    • AI ethics embedded in governance via SAP‚Äôs AI Ethics Steering Committee.

    • Guardrails against misuse, bias, and security risks.

  • Alignment with UNESCO AI ethics standards and EU AI Act compliance .

SAP‚Äôs vision is AI-first and suite-first:

  • AI copilots like Joule will become hyper-personalized.

  • More AI-driven automation across finance, HR, supply chain, and sustainability.

The future is already here. With SAP Business AI, organizations can run better, innovate faster, and empower people to focus on what truly matters.

Explore more:

  • SAP Business AI Feature Catalog

  • Learning Journeys
